ai.summary: Blue Walk is a 10.5 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom, designed for walkers with steady fitness and an interest in varied scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of paved paths, compact gravel, and grassy tracks. Expect gentle climbs and some uneven footing; conditions can be slippery when wet, so appropriate footwear is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring a waterproof layer. Carry enough water and snacks, and bring a map or GPS and a charged phone. Stay on marked trails and be mindful of other users. Daylight hours can vary, so plan accordingly.
recommended_gear: Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) in sunny months
Headtorch if walking near dusk or in low-light
Small backpack with lightweight dry bag
ai.best_seasons: All-year round with proper gear; spring and autumn typically offer milder weather and longer daylight, making for comfortable hiking.
